usr-1: i think that page contains some misinformation. it's not multiple devices that's the issue, it's the transport layer.

'sticky sessions' can only be enabled via a HTTP/HTTPS load balancer (which communicates, of course, via the HTTP layer). however, if you wish to use just SSL via the TCP layer, you must use a TCP load balancer.
the diagram on that page shows three ELBs as an example. to implement the pattern discussed here, though, you would indeed 'need' only two: one enabled as HTTP/HTTPS and one enabled as TCP/SSL.
